profileText: a Representative from Utah; born in Cedar City, Iron County, Utah, May 1981; graduated from Pahranagat Valley High School, Alamo, Nev.; B.S., Southern Utah University, Cedar City, Utah, 2003; J.D., Brigham Young University, J. Reuben Clark Law School, Provo, Utah, 2015; soil conservationist, United States Department of Agriculture, 2001-2012; deputy attorney, Washington County, Utah, 2015-2018; attorney, Utah Association of Counties, 2016-2018; attorney, Washington County Water Conservancy District, Utah, 2018-2019; staff, United States Representative Chris Stewart of Utah, 2019-2023; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Chris Stewart (November 21, 2023-present).
